column13: Exit Screen
Your SMS will be sent to you shortly. Don't forget to dial back in to *120*8864*1538# to find all the information you need about applying for visas and living in SA.
column15: Utatumiwa SMS  baada ya muda  mufupi . Usisahau piga tena  * 120 * 8864 * 1538 # ukapate taarifa zote unahitaji kuhusu namna kuomba visa  na kuishi katika SA .

column13: There are 14 types of temporary residence visas. Know your type before you start the online application. See the 'Visa Types' section or visit http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html for more info, or call VFS 012-425-3000.
column15: Kuna aina 14 za visa za muda vinazoonyeshwa. Jua aina yako Kabla kuanza maombi kwenye mtandao. Tazama kwenye sehemu ' Aina Visa  ' au http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html kwa maelezo zaidi , au piga 012-425-3000 VFS .
column19: Key for Chr Count for SMSs

column13: You need to complete a DHA-1738 online application for the correct visa type and book an appointment for your nearest VFS centre by visiting http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html
column15: Unahitaji kujaza fomu ya DHA - 1738 kwa maombi online kwa ajili ya aina ya visa sahihi  na fanya  uteuzi  katika ofisi ya VFS  karibu yako   ukitembelea http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html
column20: 1 Screen (<180 characters) Too few characters, Back navigation won't show.

column13: After completing your online form you will need to apply at a VFS visa facilitation in Durban, Cape Town, Port Elizabeth, Johanneburg, Pretoria, Rustenburg, Kimberley, Polokwane, Nelspruit, George or Bloemfontein.
column15: Baada ya kujaza fomu yako online unahitaji kuomba katika ofisi ya visa  ya VFS   katika Durban, Cape Town, Port Elizabeth, Johanneburg , Pretoria, Rustenburg, Kimberley, Polokwane, Nelspruit, George au Bloemfontein.

column13: Immediately, as you could be persecuted without a visa. Applications should be made at least 60 calendar days prior to expiry date of your passport and visa/permit.
column15: Mara moja , sababu  unaweza kushitakiwa bila viza. Unapashwa kushughulikia maombi ya  kibali  chako  angalau siku 60 za kalenda kabla ya kumalizika tarehe ya pasipoti yako na viza/ kibali.

column13: Appointment confirmation; visa fees receipt; valid passport/travel document; copy of passport; printout of completed online application form; and all supporting documents.
column15: Thibitisho ya uteuzi ; ada  ya  viza ; pasipoti/ hati halali ya kusafiria  ; nakala ya pasipoti ; printout ya fomu  maombi ya  iliyojazwa online , na  nyaraka  zote zakukusaidia

column13: Depending on the category of visa, the process time varies. Temporary residence permit applications have a minimum processing time of 8-10 weeks.
column15: Kuna tofauti ya mchakato wa kutoa viza, Kutokana  na aina  ya visa.  Maombi ya kibali cha muda  huchukua  kiwango siyo chini ya wiki 8-10.

column13: Pay by EFT, credit/debit card at centre or prepayment at a Standard Bank branch. Account name: VFS VISA PROCESSING SA (PTY) LTD; Bank: STANDARD BANK; Branch Code: 011545; Account number: 002012731
column15: Lipa na EFT , tumia kadi za mikopo / debit kwa malipo  ndani ya  ofisi  au katika tawi la  Standard Bank . Jina la akaunti : VFS VISA PROCESSING SA (PTY) LTD ; Benki : STANDARD BANK ; Tawi Kanuni : 011 545 ; Akaunti namba: 002012731

column13: Collect at VFS or have representative collect. Applicant's passport is needed. The representative also needs an authorisation letter with the applicant's name, passport no., signature, own name, ID no. and copy of ID.
column15: Chukua mwenyewe  katika VFS au tuma  mwakilishi kuchukua . Pasipoti ya mwombaji inahitajika . Mwakilishi  anahitaji barua idhini ambao ina  jina ya mwombaji, pasipoti namba , sahihi, majina yenyewe, ID namba na nakala ya ID .

column13: General work: This allows you to work in SA. You need to prove you have work and meet other conditions, or it will expire after 6 months.
column15: Kazi kwa ujumla: Hii inakuruhusu kupata kazi katika SA . Unahitaji kuthibitisha una kazi na  unaeneza sifa zingine , au itakuwa inaisha baada ya miezi 6.

column13: Corporate: Groups of factory or farm workers can apply for corporate worker visas. You will need a copy of the main corporate visa application.
column15: Ushirika : Makundi ya wafanyakazi viwandani au shambani wanaweza kuomba viza  ya ushirika. Unahitaji nakala ya maombi kuu ya visa ya kampuni.

column13: Intra company work transfer: This is when the company you work for in your home country sends you to work in their South African branch of their offices.
column15: Kazi kambuni uhamisho.Hii ndio kampuni unayo fanya kazi nayo inakutumia ufanye kazi nao South Africa branchi na ofisi zao

column13: Critical skills: When your skills are needed in SA. These skills are usually specilaised skills. To see if you have one of the skills visit http://bit.ly/1JGvPoA and view page 12.
column15: Ujuzi wa kitaalamu:Wakati ujuzi wako inahitajika SA. Ujuzi hii ni ujuzi maalum.Kama unaona una ujuzi huu nenda http://bit.ly/1JGvPoA na utazame pegi 12.

column13: Business: When you want to open a business or become part of a business in SA. You will need to invest money first into the business venture. You will need to check what the requirements are.
column15: Biashara:Ukitaka kufungua biashara au kuwa sehemu ya biashara SA. Unafaa kuwekeza pesa na biashara maridadi.Unahitaji kuangalia mahitaji.

column13: Visitors' visas are for short visits to South Africa for the purposes of travelling, doing business, visiting family or friends, or attending sports events.
column15: Viza za wageni 'ni kwa ajili ya ziara fupi nchini Afrika Kusini kwa madhumuni ya kusafiri, kufanya biashara, kutembelea familia au marafiki, au kuhudhuria matukio ya michezo

column13: Study: If you are a student and want to study in South Africa. You will be allowed to work while you're studying, but certain rules will apply to you.
column15: Masomo:kama wewe ni mwanafunzi na unataka kusomea South Africa.Utaruhusiwa kufanya kazi wakati unasoma,lakini baadhi ya sheria itatumika na wewe.

column13: Exchange: When you are younger than 25 years of age and you would like to take part in an exchange programme between your country and South Africa.
column15: Kubadilishana:Kama uki chini ya umri wa miaka 25 na ungependa sehemu katika mpango wa kubadilishana kati ya inchi yako na South Africa.

column13: Relative: When you are a direct family member of a South African citizen or someone who is a permanent resident of South Africa.
column15: Jamaa: Wakati wewe ni moja kwa moja familia ya raia wa Afrika Kusini au mtu ambaye ni mkazi wa kudumu wa Afrika Kusini.

column13: Retired person: When you are elderly and want to retire in SA. There will be financial requirements which you would be required to meet.
column15: Mtu mstaafu:Wakati wewe mzee na unataka kustaafu SA. Kutakuwa na mahitaji ya kifedha ambao unahitaji kuwa nayo.

column13: Medical: When you travel to SA for medical care. You canâ€™t work or stay longer than 3 months. You must be able to pay for the treatment.
column15: Matibabu:Wakati unapo safiri SA kwa huduma ya matibabu.Huwezi kukaa au kufanya kazi zidi ya miezi tatu.Lazima uwe na uwezo wa kulipa matibabu.

column13: Treaty: When there is a deal between South Africa and your home country. You can enter SA to take part in certain activities or programmes.
column15: Mkataba: Kama kuna mkataba kati Afrika ya Kusini na nchi yako.Unaweza kuingia SA kushiriki  katika shuguli au programu fulani.

column13: If you have visa application problems, a lawyer can help with the process. Know your rights! If you need general legal help with an immigration issue you must hire a private lawyer. TIP: Always ask about a lawyerâ€™s fees before you accept their services. Tip: Always ensure your lawyer has the right qualifications. If youâ€™re unsure, contact the Law Society of SA on 012-366-8800.
column15: Kama shida la ombi la viza, Mwanasheria anaweza kukusaidia mchakato.Jua haki yako!Kama unataka masaada wa maswala wa uhamiaji lazima ujari mwanasheria. Mwango: Daima uliza ada ya mwanasheria kabla kufanya kazi naye.Mwanga: Daima hakikisha mwanasheria ana sifa za haki. Kama hauna uhakika pigia Shirika la Wanasheria Afrika Kusini  012-366-8800.

column13: Lost or stolen passport? Transfer your temporary residence visa to your new passport. Apply for a transfer of temporary residence visa at a VFS visa centre.
column15: Kupoteza au kuibiwa pasipoti? Hamisha mhuri wa viza yako kwenye pasipoti mbya.Omba uhamisho wa viza ya muda kwa kituo cha  VFS.

column13: Rectification: fix a mistake on a temporary visa. You can fix a mistake at any VFS office in SA. You may have to pay a fee for this correction.
column15: Rekebisha :Kosoa makosa katika viza .Unaweza rekebisha makosa kwa ofisi za VFS ya SA,Unaweza lipa ada kukosoa kosa hili.

column13: Valid permit holders are safe from arrest or detention, unless you break the law. You will need to provide proof or your temporary or permanent residence visa.
column15: Wenye viibali halali wako salama habawezi kukamtiwa bure au kufungwa kizuizini,isipokuwa wanavunja sheria. Unahitaji kutoa ushahidi wa kibali au mhuri wa viza ya muda mrefu.

column13: As a migrant you need a relevant work visa to work in SA. WIth the right visa you can be employed or run your own business (you will need a business permit).
column15: Kama wewe mhamaji unahitaji kuhusika na kibali cha kazi SA.Kama una visa sahihi unaweza kuajiriwa au kufanya biashara(unahitaji kibali cha biashara).

column13: If you have a valid visa you have the right to access medical care at clinics or hospitals. Hospital workers may not know your rights. Inform them.
column15: Kama una visa sahihi una haki kuenda kliniki au hospitali.Wanfanyi kazi wa hospital labdi hawajua haki zako.Waeleze.

column13: You have the right to basic education in SA. You need a valid study permit. Have a different permit? Check if it allows you to study. Conditions may apply.
column15: Una haki ya kupata elimu ya msingi SA.Unahitaji utafiti halali kibali.Una kibali tofauti?Angalia kama inakuruhusu kusoma.Hali inaweza kuomba.

column13: SAâ€™s Constitution protects the rights of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender individuals (LGBTI). LGBT victims of unjust treatment must go to the police. LGBT victims of hate speech must lay a complaint with the SAHRC. Ask for legal assistance if youâ€™re struggling to lodge your claim. Go to the contact list for more info. For LGBTI support in Johannesburg: GALA 011-717-4239. In Pretoria: Out Wellbeing 012-430-3272. In Durban: Gay & Lesbian Network 033-342-6165.
column15: SA,hulinda,Lesbian Gay,Bisexual na Transgender  (LGBTI). LGBT Wathirika wanaenda kichuo cha polisi.LGBTI mwathirika chuki na kulaumu kwa SAHRC.Omba msaada wa kisheria.Nenda kwa mwasiliano kwa LGBTI sapoti ya Johannesburg: GALA 011-717-4239 kwa Pretoria:Out wellbeing 012-430-3272. Ya Durban:Gay&Lesbian Network 033-342-6165.

column13: If you are a victim of abuse, report it to the police.  Remember: a protection order can prevent more violence. Violence can mean intimidation, physical, sexual or verbal abuse, being threatened with abuse or when you lose your freedom. Abuse can happen when men feel angry or powerless. Get free legal help from selected women and childrenâ€™s organisations or call the toll-free helpline on 0800-150-150 for help and counselling.
column15: Kama wewe mwathirika wa unyanyasaji, ripoti kituo cha polisi.Kumbuka :ulinzi kuzuia vurugu zaidi. Kumbuka. Amri ya mahakama ya ulizi huzuia vurugu. Vurugu huweza kua vitisho, kupigwa ,kijinsia au matusi,Vitisho vya unyanyasaji au kama unapoteza uhuru .Unyanyasaji unaweza tokea wakati mwanaume ana hasira au hana nguvu.  Pata shauri ya kisheria ya bure kwenye mashirika ya wanawake na watoto au piga simu bure  0800-150-150 kupata msaada na nasaha.

column13: Valid permit holders are safe from arrest/detention unless you break the law. There are other exceptional circumstances. Police/immigration officials may request proof of your regularised stay in SA, or you may be arrested/detained. If arrested, you must prove you're allowed to be in SA with a valid visa. You'll go to a police station until the DHA verifies your ID within 48hrs. Never bribe an officer to avoid being arrested or get out of jail. This is against the law!
column15: Wenye viibali halali wako salama hawawezi  kukamatwa/kuzuizini bure isipokuwa wavunje sheria. Kuna hali nyingine ya kipekee. Polisi/afisa wa  uhamaji wanaweza kuomba kibali cha SA,ama unaweza kukukamata/ kuweka zuizini. Kama umekamatwa utaenda kituo cha polisi na DHA kuhakikisha ID yako baada ya 48hrs.Usijaribu kuhonga afisa ili usifungwe. Hio ni kinyume na sheria!

column13: There are legal ways out of your arrest. It may take time. Ask to speak to a lawyer. It is your right.  If you are arrested and have a valid visa, ask a friend or family to give copies of your valid documents to the DHA. Remember: You have the right to get legal representation if you are arrested. Tip: If you go to a magistrateâ€™s court, you can ask for â€˜legal aidâ€™. You will be able to speak to a lawyer for free.
column15: Kuna njia ya kisheria kukamatwa .Inaweza chukua muda.Uliza kuzungumuza na wakili.Ni haki yako.Kama umekamatwa na una visa halali,uliza familia kama wanaeza kupa nakala ya visa yako kwa DHA.Kumbuka wana haki ya uwakilishi kama umefungwa.Tip:Ukifika kwa mwahaliku una haki ya mwanasheria

column13: The immigration/DHA officer should verify your documents in 48hr or release you. You must carry your docs on you or the officer must help you find it. You have the right to a phone call to get copies of your permit. The officer must try to confirm your status with the DHA. Itâ€™s your right to write a statement to the DHA if you disagree with the decision to detain/deport you. You canâ€™t be detained for more than 30 days unless the court has a warrant. You may write a statement to the judge. The court must inform you of its decision in writing.
column15: Uhamaji/DHA afisi unaweza kuverify kati zako kwa 48hr ama akuwachilie.Lazima ubebe hati zako au afisa akusaidie kuzitafuta.Afisa athibitishe hadhi yako na DHA.Ni haki yako kuandika kauli DHA ulipokubali uamuzi/kufukuzwa.Uwezi fukuzwa zaidi ya siku 30 isipokuwa mahakamani ina kibali.Unaweza andika kauli.Mahakama lazima waku ambiye uamuzi.

column13: If you are taken to the Deportation Centre, you may contact a lawyer for legal advice. LHR visits the centre every week. Ask your family to notify Lawyers for Human Rights about your situation and that you need help. If you donâ€™t have legitimate reasons to stay in SA with the necessary documents, youâ€™ll be kept at the centre and deported. Contact Lawyers for Human Rights if your conditions of detention are unsafe or violate your dignity.
column15: Kama umepelekwa kituo cha kufukuzwa,pigia mwana sheria kwa usaidizi. LHR hutembelea kila wiki.Uliza familia yako kama wanajua Lawyers for Human Rights kama najua hali yako na unataka usaidizi. Kama hauna namna yeyote kuishi SA na hati halali, utaekwa kituo cha kufukuzwa. Pigia Lawyers for Human Rights kama hali yako ni mbya.

column13: As a migrant you need a relevant work visa to work in SA. With the right visa you can be employed or run your own business. If you want to set up your own business in South Africa, you need to have a valid business permit.
column15: Mhamaji unahitaji husika viza ya  kufanya kazi SA. Na viza sahihi unaweza kufanya kazi au kufanya biasahara. Kama unahitaji kufanaya biashara Afrika Kusini, unahitaji kibali halali ya biashara.

column13: There are different types of business permits you can get. You will be required to invest a prescribed financial capital contribution. Please go to http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/ for more info.
column15: Kuna aina tofauti ya vibali ya biashara unaweza pewa.Unahitajika kuwa na mtaji fulani kama mchango wa kifedha.Tafadhali nenda http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/mwengineo.

column13: SECURITY/CAR GUARD: You must register at PSIRA.  Only SA nationals, permanent residents & refugees with immunity can work as guards. TEACHER: If you are a public school teacher you need to check your international teaching qualification with the SA Qualifications Authority (SAQA). The SAQA evaluation doesnâ€™t guarantee a job. Also register with SA Council for Educators (SACE). Go to www.sace.org.za for more info.
column15: USALAMA/CAR GUARD:Lazma kusajili kwa PSIRA. Tu SA Raia,Makaazi Ya Kidumu na Wakimbizi kinga ndio wanaeza fanya kazi ya usalama.MWALIMU:Kama wewe ni mwalimu wa umma angalia  mafundisho wakimataifa na (SAQA). Tadhamini haimanishi utapata kazi SA Council for Educators(SACE).Nenda www.sace/org.za mengineo.

column13: Migrants with foreign nursing qualifications must register with the South African Nursing Council (SANC). Visit www.sanc.co.za for a list of documents you'll need to submit. If you're already registered back home, you need a SANC affidavit. Your qualification and experience will be evaluated. If you meet the SANC requirements, you must write an entry exam based on your area of competence. If your application is successful, you must submit a registration form and pay a fee.
column15: Wahamaji wenye sifa uugzi kigeni  wasajili na South African Nursing Council(SANC).nenda www.sanc.coza kwa orodha unahitaji kuwasilisha.Kama umesajili rudi nyumbani,unahitaji SANC chukua hati ya kiapo.Kufusu yako na uzoefu tathmini.

column13: The Department of Health (DOH) employs foreign doctors with the right qualifications and experience in government hospitals. To register, contact the DOHâ€™s Foreign Workforce Management Programme (FWMP) on 012-312-0467. To register, you need a job offer from a government hospital or health department. Apply for a formal endorsement from FWMP. When you have a job offer and endorsement, apply to register with the Health Professions Council of SA (HPCSA): 012-338-9350.
column15: Idara Ya Afya(DOH) ajiri madaktari na kufusu kazi kwa hospitali ya serekali.Kusajili,Pigia DOH's kigeni kazi ya usimamizi mpango (FWMP) 012-312-0467.Unahitaji kazi Serekali au kwa Afya.Wakati una kazi kutoa mhuri ,Omba usajili Health Proffessions Counsil ya SA (HPCSA): 012-338-9350.

column13: There are laws in SA that protect you from discrimination or unfair treatment when you are at work. Your employer canâ€™t discriminate against you because youâ€™re an immigrant. The law protects you from unfair treatment. The law also protects your minimum working hours, leave, salary and the way you are dismissed.
column15: Kuna sheria SA ya kukulinda kwa ubaguzi au haki kutokana na kazi yako.Mfanyi kazi ukifanaya ubaguzi kwa sababu wewe mhamaji.Sheria ina linda wakatu wako wa kazi,kutoka,mshahara kufukuzwa kazi.

column13: You can claim from the UIF if you end up unemployed because youâ€™re sick or have a baby. You need a 13-digit ID number to claim. If you are hurt or become infected with a disease at work and you end up being disabled, the Compensation Fund will pay out money. If you die because of your injuries your dependants will get money. The Compensation Fund will help to pay the medical bills.
column15: Unadai kutoka UIF ukikaa bila ajira kwa sababu uko mgonjwa au mtoto mgonjwa.Unahitaji 13-digits ID numbari za madai.Kama kuambukizwa na magonjwa kwa kazi au mwelevu,Mfuko wa fidia kulipa fedha.Kama ukiaga kwa sababu majeruhi wa tegemezi watalipa hela. Fidia ya fedha watalipa bili za matibabu.

column13: Apply for a medical visa in your country before you travel to SA to get medical care. See 'Temporary Visa' section for info. Remember: this visa doesnâ€™t mean you will get free health care. You'll have to pay for it yourself. Already in SA with a visa? You have the right to access medical care services just like anybody else. You can contact LHR when youâ€™ve a problem accessing public health services.
column15: Omba visa ya matibabu kila hujasafiri SA kwa huduma ya matibabu.Ona 'Muda Visa' sehemu kwa maelezo.Kumbuza hii visa haimanishi utapata matibabu za bure.Unafaa kulipa. Tayari SA na Visa?Una haki ya kupata matibabu kama wenzio. Unaweza pigia LHR kama unashida na huduma afya ya umma.

column13: People from SADC countries pay the same medical fees as SA nationals. As a SADC national, your healthcare payments will be based on how much you earn. Take the following with you to the hospital: ID; appointment card; payslip/proof of salary; proof of address. If you donâ€™t have the right documents or if you're a non-SADC national, you'll pay the highest fees.
column15: Watu kutoka SADC nchi wanalipa ada ya matibabu SA kama  wanainchi. Kama SADC mwanainchi wa SADC, gharama ya matibabu hutokana na  mshahara wako. Peleka yafuatao hospitali:ID; kadi ya uteuzi, barua ya mshahara/ushahidi wa mapato;ushidi wa anuani. Kama hauna hati maaalumu au kama wewe siyo mwenyeji wa SADC ,utalipa ada zaidi.

column13: Clinics provide treatment/medicine, mostly free. Make an appointment at your nearest clinic, unless itâ€™s an emergency. Take your valid Section 22/24 permit. If youâ€™re still waiting for yours, ask an NGO for a letter (see â€˜Useful Servicesâ€™). To go to hospital, you need a letter from the clinic unless itâ€™s an emergency. Canâ€™t pay the public hospital fees? Get an affidavit from the police to explain, or contact an NGO. DONâ€™T go to a private Dr/hospital if you canâ€™t pay the fees.
column15: Kliniki hutoa matibau/dawa,kwa bure. Fanya uteuzi kliniki ilio karibu na we.Chukua kifungu cha section 22/24kibali.Uliza NGO kwa barua('Huduma Muhimu;).Nenda hospitali,Unahitaji kliniki kama ni dharura.Huwezi lipa  ada umma?Unweza pata kiapo kituo ya polisi,au pigia NGO.USIENDE hospitali ya binafsi kama huwezi lipa.

column13: Suffering traumatic events (abuse/violence/natural disaster) can lead to Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Signs of PTSD: struggling to sleep/concentrate; nightmares; flashbacks; anxiety; helplessness; fear. Share your story if you have PTSD. In counselling youâ€™ll talk about your experience/feelings. Visit the Trauma Clinic in Joburg or Trauma Centre for Survivors of Violence & Torture in Cape Town. There are other trauma clinics in SA. See â€˜Contact Listâ€™ for more info.
column15: Mateso ya kumiza (nyayasaji/vurugu/asili mafaa) yaweza kukupa Post-traumatic machafuko (PTSD). Ishara ya PTSD: Hofu shirika yako PTSD.Tembelea kliniki ya Trauma ya Joburg au Centa Trauma wanao hepuka vurugu&mateso ya Cape Town.Kuna kliniki zingine za Trauma ya SA.Ona Orodha'mwengineo.Mateso ya  matukio ya kuumiza (matumizi mabaya / vurugu / janga la asili) unaweza kusababisha Matatizo  Baada ya kiwewe (PTSD). Dalili za PTSD: kushindwa kulala / kujihusisha; jinamizi; kumbukuku; wasiwasi; unyonge; hofu. Ongea hadithi yako na mtu kama una PTSD. Katika nasaha, itabidi wewe uzungumze kuhusu uzoefu wako / hisia. Nenda Kliniki ya  kiwewe katika Joburg au Kituo cha Waathirika wa Unyanyasaji  & Mateso mjini Cape Town. Kuna kliniki nyingine za kiwewe katika SA.Ona 'Orodha ya Mawasiliano' kwa maelezo zaidi.

column13: HIV can go unnoticed for up to 10yrs. Know your status and get treatment sooner to help you lead a normal life. HIV weakens your bodyâ€™s power to fight infections such as pneumonia. There is no cure. You can get HIV by having unprotected sex or using unsterilised needles/syringes. If youâ€™re HIV+ & pregnant, your baby can get HIV in the womb, after birth or by breastfeeding. Tip: You canâ€™t get HIV through casual contact, like working together, kissing, or sharing space.
column15: HIV inaweza kuenda  kwa 10yrs.Jua hali yako na pata matibabu  usaidizi. HIV hudhoofisa mwili kama pneumonia.Hamna tiba.Unaweza pata HIV bila ngono wembe au  sindano/syrings. Kama uko HIV+&Mimba,unaweza kuanbukiza mtoto,baada ya kuzaa. Tip: Huwezi pata HIV kupitia mwenendo wa kawaida,Kama kufanya kazi,kissing au kupeana nafasi.

column13: To know your HIV status you must get a blood test, available for free at most public health centres. Youâ€™ll receive counselling before and after your test. Sometimes two tests are done. Youâ€™ll know your status after 20 minutes. Your blood sample might have to go to a laboratory. Youâ€™ll only know your status in a few days. HIV tests are very accurate. Many organisations in SA offer HIV tests, counselling and treatment. Go to www.tac.org.za or the contact list for more info.
column15: Jua hali yako ya VVU  ukipimwa damu , ni bure katika hospitali mbalimbali za umma. Pata ushauri  kabla na baada ya kupimwa .Mara nyingine unahitaji kupimwa mara mbilii. Utajua  baada ya dakika 20.Kipimo cha VVU kipo sahihi. Mashirika mengi mno  SA hupima VVU, hufanya nasaha na hupana matibabu.Nenda www.tac.org.za au pigia orodha ya mawasiano kwa habari zaidi.

column13: Pregnant women with HIV should ask for Nevirapine at public health centres. It can prevent HIV infection during childbirth. Nevirapine is an antiretroviral drug (ARV). Go to the contact list or www.tac.org.za for info on centres with ARV treatments.
column15: Mama mwenye mimba hupata Nevirapine kwa hospitali ya umma. Huzuia VVU kumwaambukiza  mtoto wakti wa  kuzaliwa.Nevirapine ni dawa ya kurefusha maisha (ARV). Nenda kwenye  listi au www.tac.org.za kupata habari za senta za kutoa matibabu  ya ARV.

column13: ARV treatment begins during a serious HIV-related illness or when your CD4 count drops below 350. Most people start ARV 8-10 years after infection. It isnâ€™t the same for all. See a doctor and get the best treatment for you! Remember: It doesnâ€™t matter what your document status is - you are entitled to free ARV treatment.
column15: Mgonjwa huanza ARV wakati anaumwa vibaya na ugonjwa unaohusiana na VVU au wakati CD4 yake inashuka chini 350. Watu wengi huanza ARV miaka 8-10 baada ya kuambukizwa. Sio sawa kwa wote . Muone daktari na upate matibabu bora kwa ajili yako! Kumbuka : Usijali  kibali chako au hati yako - una haki ya matibabu bure ARV .

column13: If you wish to report a rape, go straight to the police. Donâ€™t shower, drink liquids or use the toilet â€“ this helps with evidence. You CAN change clothes, but take along the clothes you were wearing. You donâ€™t need to report it to get medical treatment. If HIV negative before the assault, you have a right to a 28-day course of antiretrovirals to prevent HIV, but must take it within 72hrs. Help/info: LoveLife 0800-121-900; AIDS Helpline 0800-01-23-22; AIDS Hotline 0800-11-0605
column15: Unahitaji kuripoti ubakaji,Nenda kituo cha polisi.Usioge,usikunywe maji au chooni-husaidia ushahidi.Unaweza badilisha nguo,lakini huchukua muda.Unafaa kupata msaada wa matibabu.Kama uko HIV nasi kabla ya shambulio. Lazma uchukue kabla ya 72hrs.Help/info: Mapenzi  0800-121-900; AIDS Helpline 0800-01-23-22; AIDS Hotline 0800-11-0605

column13: Everyone has the right to basic education in SA. You must have a valid study permit to study in SA. In SA on another valid permit? Check first if your permit allows you to study in SA. Some conditions might apply.
column15: Kila mtu ana haki ya elimu SA.Lazima uwe na kibali utafiti SA. Au kibali halali nyingine? Angalia kwanza kama kibali  yako ina kuruhusu kufanya kazi SA.Hali inaweza kuomba.

column13: A creche is a preschool daycare centre for ages 1-6. Primary school: 7-13. Secondary school (academic or technical): 13-19. If you can't pay the fee, ask to work in exchange for a cheaper fee. Your child must have a visa and passport to be in SA. Children in SA must go to school â€“ itâ€™s the law. Tip: School age groups are flexible, so a child might be older than their classmates, but most government schools don't allow students to be 2yrs older than the gradeâ€™s age group.
column15: Creche in shule ya miaka 1-6. Shule ya msingi  7-13.Shule ya Sekondari (taalamu au kiufundi): 13-19. Kama huwezilipa ada, Uliza kufanya kazi badala  bei nafuu. Mtoto lazima awe na viza na pasipoti kuishi SA. Lazima watoto wende shule-ni sheria. Mwanga: Umri wa makundi shuleni ni rahisi, hivyo mtoto anaweza kuwa na umri mkubwa kuliko wenzake, lakini shule nyingi za serikali haziruhusu wanafunzi kuwa miaka 2 zaidi ya umri wa daraja.

column13: Your child must have at least a birth certificate, clinic card or old report card to register.  There'll be conditions for your child to attend school during your stay in SA. Register for a primary school closest to your house. English not good? Take a friend with who can help. Schools get full quickly so apply early (from July). If the school closest to your house is full, the school must show you another school that can help. If you struggle to register, the school close to your house must refer you to the Dept. of Education (DOE). If the school refuses admission, ask for a letter on their letterhead signed by the principal and take it to the DOE. Still canâ€™t find a school? Contact a social service provider for education or LHR. More info on the contact list.
column15: Mtoto wako lazima awe na cheti cha kuzaliwa,kliniki kadi au kadi reporti ya kuandikisha.Kutakuwa na hali ya shule ukikaa SA.Sajili msingi karibu na kwako.Kingereza si nzuri?Chukua rafiki anaweza kusaidia.Shule hujaa haraka omba haraka (kutoka julai).Kama shule karibu wewe zimejaa,Shule lazima ikuonyeshe shule nyingine.Kama una panagana kujiandikisha shule karibu wewe lazima wakutekeleze Dept of Education (DOE).Kama shule inakataa kwa ajili ya kuandikisha,Uliza barua ilio sainiwa na mwalimu mkuu na upeleke DOE. Bado huwezi pata shule? Pigia huduma za kijamii ya elimu au LHR.Maelezo zaidi kwa orodha.

column13: If you canâ€™t pay school fees, ask the school to reduce them by completing an exemption form. You must show proof of income (payslip/affidavit/letter of support) & give info on your expenses & responsibilities. Apply for exemption at the start of each term. Keep all letters & appointments with the school. If you ignore notices the school can make you pay. Find a NGO in the contact list for help with the form. Uniforms & learning materials also cost money. If you canâ€™t afford a uniform, your child can wear clothes that resemble it, but must still go to school. Second-hand uniforms are cheaper. Ask at the school. You shouldnâ€™t pay a registration fee. Public schools canâ€™t ask your child to leave if you canâ€™t pay.
column15: Kama huezi lipa ada ya shule,uliza kama wanaeza kukupunguzia na kupa msahama ya ada.Onyesha ushahidi (payslip,kiampo,barua ya msaada)& peana maelezo ya gharama yako&majukumu.Omba musahama kwa kila term. Weka kila barua &utezi na shule.Ukipuuza tarifa hii shule yaeza kufanya ukalipa. Pata NGO na orodha ya kukusaidia na sare.Sare &vifaa vya kujifunza na gharama. Kama huwezi kudumu sare,Mtoto wako anaweza kuvaa nguo zinazo fanana,Lakini lazima ende shule.Sare za mkono wa pili ni nafuu.Usilipe ada ya usajili.Shule za umma hiwezi fukuza mtoto kama haezi lipa ada.

column13: Children with special learning needs can go to a special education school. Contact the Departmenr of Education and ask about schools. Placing your child in a special education school is a long process. Get your child on a waiting list as soon as possible.
column15: Watoto wenye hufunzi maalum waeza kuenda shule maalum.Pigia Department of Education ulize kuhusu shule.Kuweka mtoto wako kwa elimu maalum ni mchakato ndefu.Weka mtoto kwa orodha ya kusubiri kama i wezekanavyo.

column13: You can study at a university to further your education or change your education from your home country to a SA degree. A university degree can help you to get into the SA job market. Remember: You must have a valid study permit to study in SA, you'll need to apply at the tecknikon or university before you come to SA.
column15: Unaweza somea university ili kuendeleza elimu yako au kubadilisha elimu yako ya nyumani kwa SA shahada. Shahada ya university yaweza kukusaidia kupata soko SA, lazima uwe na utafiti halali kibali kusoma SA,unahitaji kuomba kwa tecknikon au university kabla kuja SA.

column13: You need to pay an international registration & fee as an international student. Each university has thier own processes and will advise you when you apply to study there.
column15: Unahitaji kulipa sajili ya kimataifa &ada na mwanafunzi wa kamataifa.Kila university. Kila university ina mchakato na ushauri ukiomba masomo hapo.

column13: You must be 16 years or older with a valid passport and visa. You must have proof of residence: a rental contract, telephone/utility bill in your name. You need to prove your income with a payslip or affidavit. It may be difficult to open a bank account in SA. Even if you have the right documents, the bank can decide if they want to give you an account or not. You can also ask a legal counsellor to assist.
column15: Lazima uwe na umri wa miaka 16 au mkumbwa na pasipoti ambao ina visa halali. Lazima uwe na ushahidi wa makaazi:mkataaba wa kukodisha,simu/bili ya huduma kwa majina yako.Unahitaji kuwa na ushahidi mapato na payslip au kiapo.Unaweza kuwa mgumo kufungua akkaunti ya benki SA. Hata kama una hati sahihi,Benki inaweza amua kukupa akkounti au la.Waeleza kuuliza mashauri wa kisheria kwa usaidizi.

column13: SAâ€™s constitution protects the rights of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender individuals (LGBTI). LGBT victims of unjust treatment must go to the police. LGBT victims of hate speech may lay a complaint with the SAHRC or approach the Equality Court for relief.
column15: Katiba ya SA's hulinda haki ya Leabian, Gay, Bisexual &Transgender kipekee (LGBTI).LGBT wathirika  kuthulumu matibabu huenda kituo cha polisi. LGBT waathirika lugha ya chuki kulaumu SAHRC au mbinu mahakama kwa ajali ya masaada.

column13: The Refugee act states that the LGBTI group can get protection if they are persecuted for their sexual orientation. Donâ€™t be afraid to disclose your sexual orientation when applying for asylum. The RRO must treat your claim with confidentiality.
column15: Sheria ya Wakimbizi inasema kwamba kundi la LGBTI wanaweza kupata ulinzi na hifadhi kama wangine juu  kuteswa kwa hisia zao za kimapenzi. Ukiwe na hofu ya kufichua upendeleo wako wa kimapenzi wakati unapoomba ukimbizi.Ni lazima RRO atibu madai yako kwa siri.

column13: Contact Lawyers for Human Rights (LHR) or another legal organisation if your claim isnâ€™t treated with sensitivity and respect. www.lhr.org.za; 011-339-1960 or 012-320-2943.
column15: Pigia Wanasheria wa haki za Binadamu (LHR) au shirika la sheria nyingine kama madai yako kutibiwa kwa heshima and unyeti. www.lhr.org.za; 011-339-1960 au 012-320-2943.

column13: Abuse is illegal in SA. Get free legal help from selected women and childrenâ€™s organisations or call the toll-free helpline on 0800-150-150 for help and counselling.
column15: Unyanyasaji ni kinyume cha sheria katika SA . Kupata msaada wa bure wa kisheria kutoka kwa mashirika ya wanawake na watoto mashirika au piga simu bure  juu ya 0800-150-150 kwa msaada na ushauri nasaha .

column13: Women and children have the right to live free from physical, verbal or sexual abuse. All types of abuse must be reported to the police. Remember: a protection order can prevent more violence. Violence can mean intimidation, physical, sexual or verbal abuse, being threatened with abuse or when you lose your freedom. Abuse by men or women is not acceptable and you can report them.
column15: Wanawake na watoto wana haki ya kuishi uhuru bila kupigwa, matusi au unyanyasaji ya kijinsia. Aina zote za unyanyasaji ripoti kwa polisi. Kumbuka: ulinzi huzuia vurugu zaidi.Vurugu inamaanisha vitendo, kupigwa, unyanyasaji,matusi, kutishiwa au kupoteza uhuru wako.Unyanyasaji wa mwanaume au mke haikubaliki  na unaweza kuuripoti.

column13: If you or your child suffers from abuse, you must report it to the police. The police will open a criminal case. You must make a statement. Youâ€™ll get a case number. An officer will investigate your case. Some police stations have special units for domestic violence, sexual offences and child protection. Go to a police station close to your home. If you donâ€™t, your case will take longer to process. Youâ€™ll go for a medical examination and counseling.
column15: Kama mtoto wako hutekeza unyanyasaji,Lazima uripoti kwa polisi. Polisi atafungua kesi. Utapewa kesi namba . Afisa atachunguza kesi yako. Vituo vingine vina vitengo maalum kwa ujumbani,makosa na kujiaminiana and ulizi ya watoto. Nenda kwa polisi station karibu na we,kesi yako itachukua muda .Utaenda  kupata matibabu ya afya na nasaha.

column13: If youâ€™re afraid of more violence or feel threatened, you can go to court and get a protection order. You donâ€™t need a lawyer. A protection order can order your abuser to stop abusing you, to stay away from you or force him/her out of your home. Documents like medical reports and photos of your injuries can help your abuse case.  If thereâ€™s enough proof of abuse, youâ€™ll get an interim protection order and suspended warrant of arrest.
column15: Kama unaogopa vurugu au kutishiwa,unaeza enda mahakama ili upate amri ya ulinzi.Huhitaji mwanasheria. Ulinzi ili inasharti anayekunyayasa aache ,akae mbali na wewe au nyumbani yako.Hati kama ripoti ya matibabu au mapicha ya majeruhi yaweza kukusaidia ufungue kesi.Una ushahidi ya kutosha,Utapata amri ya muda ya  ulinzi na kibali cha kumkamatwa.

column13: If the abuser disobeys the order, you can get him/her arrested. Youâ€™ll need to go back to court a second time. Your abuser must also be there. The court will listen to your case. The court may give you a final protection order. If your abuser disobeys the order, he/she can get arrested.
column15: Mnyanyasaji aki kataa amri ya mahakama, anaweza kufungwa.Unahitajika kurudi kahakama mara ya pili.Mnyanyasaji wako pia atakuepo.Mahakama itasikiza kesi yako na inaweza kuto amri ya mwisho.Mnyanyasaji wako akidharau amri atafungwa.

column13: Human trafficking is a form of modern-day slavery where people are taken to another country under a false act. Theyâ€™re exploited, can't leave and are tricked with false promises of good jobs and better lives. They're forced to work in brutal and inhumane conditions. Traffickers are dangerous and shouldnâ€™t be confronted. Call the International Organisation for Migration (0800-555-999) or go to a police station if you know of someone who has been trafficked.
column15: Biashara ya binadamu ni aina-ya siku za kisiasa ambapo watu huchukuliwa nchi zao kwa sheria ya uongo. Ni vibaya, huwezi enda na mkadangaywa na ahadi ya uongo ya kazi na maisha bora. Wana lazimishwa kufanya kazi kikatii na hali ya kinyama.Wafanyabiashara ni hatari haipsawi kubalika.Pigia International Organisation for Migration (0800-555-999) au nenda kwa polisi station kama unajua mtu anasafirishwa.

column13: Children without a parent or guardian must be referred to the Department of Social Development. A social worker will be assigned to the child. The social worker will go to the Childrenâ€™s Court. The court will confirm if the child is in need of care.
column15: Watoto bila wazazi au malezi lazima kusudia Idara ya Maendeleo ya Kijamii. Mfanyikazi wa jamii ata saini. Mfanyikazi wa jamii ataenda mahakama ya watoto.Mahakama itathibitisha kama mtoto anahitaji huduma.

column13: The social worker will verify the childâ€™s placement in a temporary place of safety. A report must be compiled. If the child is a migrant, the social worker must try to find and reunite the family in the country of origin. If the family canâ€™t be located and the child canâ€™t be returned home, you must contact a legal counsellor. This is important: children must get documented as soon as possible, otherwise they risk becoming stateless.
column15: Mfanyikazi wa jamii atathibitisha kama ni mahali ya usalama.Repoti lazima zikusanywe.Kama mtototo ni mhamaji,mfanyikazii wa jamii atatafuta familia inchi asili. Kama familia haiko na mtoto hawezi rudishwa nyumbani, lazima uwasialiane wna mshauri kisheria.Hii ni muhimu:Watoto lazima wape hati haraka iwezekanavyo ,wako hatari kutokuwa na utaifa.

column13: Xenophobia is an irrational hatred towards foreigners or an unreasonable fear or hatred of the unfamiliar persons. If you are a victim of xenophobic attacks, you must report it to the police. Go to the police station closest to your home. You must explain in detail what happened. The police will open a case. You will get a case number. Keep it safe! If youâ€™ve lost your document, get an affidavit from the police that explains your situation. Go to the RRO for a new permit.
column15: Xenophobia ni chuki dhidi ya wageni  au mantiki hofu au chuki ya watu wasio wa kawaida. Kama wewe ni mwathirika wa mashambulizi dhidi ya wageni, ni lazima toa taarifa kwa polisi. Nenda kwenye kituo cha polisi karibu na nyumba yako. Lazima uelezea kwa urefu kile kilichotokea. Polisi itafungua kesi. Utapata namba ya kesi.Yiweke salama! Kama ulipoteza hati yako,chukua  hati ya kiapo kutoka kwa polisi ambo inaelezea hali yako. Nenda RRO kwa kupata kibali mpya.

column13: You qualify for permanent residence if you've had a work/spousal visa for 5 years OR you are a child under 21 of someone with permanent residence OR you are a child of a citizen.
column15: Unastahili makaazi ya kudumu kama ulikuwa na kazi/uliishi kwa viza mke wo  miaka 5 au  uko mtoto chini ya umri wa 21 wa mtu ana kibali cha kukaa muda mrefu au ni  mtoto wa raia.

column13: Application requires an interview with Home Affairs officer at VFS centre when submitting your application form. Married couples/partners must both sign form and attend interview together.
column15: Maombi inahitaji mahojiano naAfisa wa Idara ya Uhamiaji katika VFS centa wakati unapeleka fomu. Wenye ndoa/washirika lazima wa saini fomu na kuenda mahojiano pamoja.

column13: Complete a BI-947 online application for the correct visa type and book an appointment for your nearest VFS centre by visiting http://www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html
column15: Jaza fomu ya BI-947 kwa  maombi  online ya visa sahihi na fanya uteuzi kwa ofisi ya VFS karibi nawe ukitembelea http:www.vfsglobal.com/dha/southafrica/index.html

column13: After completing the online form, you need to apply at VFS centre in Durban, Cape Town, Port Elizabeth, Joburg, Pretoria, Rustenburg, Kimberley, Polokwane, Nelspruit, George or Bloemfontein.
column15: Baada ya kujaza online fomu,unahitaji kuomba VFS senta ya Durban, Cape Town, Port Elizabeth, Joburg, Pretoria, Rustenburg, Kimberley, Polokwane, Nelspruit, George or Bloemfontein.

column7: Makazi ya kudumuVibali vya kukaa muda mrefu
column13: Please see VFS website here http://bit.ly/1T93608 for list of documents needed per visa type. Make sure you have all required documents or your application will be rejected.
column15: Tafadhali mtandao wa  VFS ni http://bit.ly/1T93608 kwa orodha ya hati unayohitaji  kwa kila aina ya viza. Hakikisha una hati zinazotakiwa au ombi lako litakataliwa.

column13: Permanent residence permit applications have a minimum processing time of 8-10 months. Track your application online on VFS Global website to determine your application status.
column15: Maombi ya kibali cha kudumu hakichukui chini ya wakati miezi  8-10. Fuatilia ombi lako VFS Global website kujua hadhi la ombi lako.

column13: Pay by EFT, credit/debit card at the centre or prepayment at a Standard Bank branch. Acount name: VFS VISA PROCESSING SA (PTY) LTD; Bank: STANDARD BANK; Branch Code: 011545; Account number no: 002012731
column15: Lipa na EFT,credit/debit card kwa centa au prepayment kwa Standard Bank branch. Acount name: VFS VISA PROCESSING SA (PTY);Bank: STANDARD BANK; Brank Code: 011545; Acoount number no: 002012731

column13: Collect at VFS or have representative collect. Applicant's passport is needed. The representative also needs an authorisation letter with the applicant's name, passport no., signature, own name, ID no. and copy of ID.
column15: Chukua mwenyewe  au mwanakilishi katika VFS.Pasipoti ya mwombaji pasip inahitajika. Mwanakilishi anahitaji idhini ya barua na mwombaji jina lake,pasiposi no,saini,jina lake,Id no na copy ya ID.

column13: If you need proof of your permanent residence visa, you will need to fill in a form on www.vfsglobal.com to make an appointment at VFS. Take your documents and you'll have to pay a fee.

A stateless person doesnâ€™t have citizenship in any country. You are also at risk of being stateless if your nationality status is undecided. Not all undocumented persons are considered stateless, e.g. when your birth isnâ€™t registered or if you donâ€™t have a birth certificate, ID or passport.
column15: Mtu asie kuwa na utaifa hana uraia wa wa nchi yeyote. Utakuwa kwa hatari na utaifa kama uraia wako haiamuliwa. Siyo wote amabao hawana nyaraka kuchukuliwa utaifa,e.g. mara kuzaliwa kwako haijasajiliwa au huna cheti cha kuzaliwa,ID au pasipoti.

column13: An undocumented personâ€™s risk of being stateless increases when you belong to a certain category or when certain factors are present like: birth outside your parentsâ€™ country of nationality; death or desertion of your parent(s); Irregular migration across international borders; mixed nationality of your parents; loss of clinic cards or records; If youâ€™re close to an international border with high cross-border movement; when the law doesnâ€™t permit dual nationality.
column15: Mtu asie na nyaraka za kumtumbua huongeza hatari ya utaifa  wakati yupo kwenye kikundi fulani au mambo fulani yapo kama: kuzaliwa nje ya nchi  wazazi'  ya uraia ;kufa au kuachwa na wazazi; Uhamaji haramu wa kuvuka mipaka ya kimataifa; mchanganyiko wa  utaifa wa wazazi; kupoteza kadi ya kliniki au rikodi; Kama uko karibu na mipaka ya kimataifa ambao ina uhamaji wa hali ya juu ,au  wakati sheria haikubalie mtu kuwa taifa  mbili.

column13: A birth certificate proves your place of birth and identifies your parent/s. Itâ€™s the most important proof of your nationality. South African citizens born outside SA are entitled to a SA birth certificate. Foreign children born in SA are entitled to a birth certificate, but this doesnâ€™t mean theyâ€™re South African citizens. Children born in SA must be registered within 30 days. If you were born in SA, apply for late birth registration. Applications close in December 2015.
column15: Vyeti vya kuzaliwa huonyesha ulipozaliwa na wazazi wako. Ni ushahidi muhimu wa utaifa wako.Wa SA naozaliwa nje wana haki ya kuwa na vyeti vya kuzaliwa vya Sa. Watoto wageni wanaozaliwa SA wana haki ya vyeti vya kuzaliwa lakini haimanishi wao ni raia wa SA. Watoto wanaozaliwa SA wasajili ndani ya siku 30. Kama umezaliwa SA, omba usajili ya kuzaliwa. KMaombi haa atafungwa Decemba 2015.

column13: You have a claim to SA citizenship if you: were born to a parent with SA citizenship at the time of your birth; were born in SA to a parent who was a permanent resident of SA at the time of your birth and if you lived in SA until the age of 18; have been adopted by a SA citizen; applied for and received a certificate of naturalisation from the DHA; were born in SA and have no other citizenship, nationality or right to other citizenship or nationality.
column15: Kama unamadai ya uraia SA kama: Umezaliwa na mzazi ako na uraia wa SA ulipozaliwa; Umezaliwa SA na mzazi ako na kibalin cha kukaa muda mrefu SA wakati ulipozaliwa,kama umeishi SA mpaka umri wa miaka 18; umechekuliwa na raia wa SA; omba na upokee vyeti vya uraia kwa DHA; umezaliwa SA huna uraia,utaifa,raia au haki ya uraia mwingine .

column13: If you struggle to register a birth or access nationality in your country of birth, contact Lawyers for Human Rights on 011-339-1960 or 012-320-2943.
column15: Kama una shida ya vyeti vya kuzaliwa au uraia wa nchi yako,pigia Wanasheria wa haki za Binadamu  kwa 011-339-1960 au 012-320-2943.

column13: This mobile info system is only a guide. It isnâ€™t the same as complete legal advice. Users should contact a law clinic for complex issues. LHR will not be liable for any loss from actions taken as a result of this service.
column15: Hii ni fumo wa simu  wa kutoa mwongozo.Siyo mashauri kisheria kamili. Watumiaji wanaweza pigia kliniki ya sheria kwa masuala magumu. LHR haiwezi shugulika vitendo au hatua ya huduma.

column13: Your registration and personal details are confidential and safe. These details will only be used when youâ€™ve made a follow up request or report to Lawyers for Human Rights.
column15: Usajili wako na maelezo ya binafsi ni siri. Hizi maelezo itatumika too kama kufuatiliwa na ripoti ya Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu.

column13: The registration for this service is free, as is the actual mobile application. You will only be charged according to USSD data fees per their usage.
column15: Kusajili Kwa  huduma hii ni bure,ni programu halisi ya simu. Utalipa kulingana na gharama ya data ya USSD  na jinsi ulioitumia.

column13: This service is brought to you by Lawyers for Human Rights, and LHR reserves the right to terminate the usage of this service if you or any user is deemed to be abusing it.
column15: Huduma hii huletwa kwako na Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu ,na LHR ina haki ya kuondoa huduma hii kama ukionyesha au ukinyayasa.

column13: Lawyers for Human Rights is a NGO. We aim to promote awareness, protection and enforcement of legal and human rights. Our services are free of charge subject to the means test.
column15: Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu in NGO. Lengo letu ni kukuza,ulinzi na utekelezaji haki za kibinadamu. Huduma zetu ni bure chini ya mtihani wa maana.

column13: Should you require more information or assistance, please visit www.lhr.org.za or call Lawyers for Human Rights on 011-339-1960 or 012-320-2943.
column15: Lazima unahitaji maelezo na huduma, tafadhali enda www.lhr.org.za au pigia Lawyers for Human Rights kwa 011-339-1960 au 012-320-2943.
